text: and here's Nick from magic I let Nick

name is Nick Novak I'm one of the
cofounders of a startup called magic and
I'm just going to be talking today about
how we developed an ecosystem of
software to handle your life 24/7 so
just a little bit about what magic is
magic is what we call an on-demand
personal assistant that you can text
from your phone to get whatever you want
24/7 and so just like in this image over
here let's say you wake up and you have
a you find a citation on your dashboard
on your car you can you can get your
phone text magic and we will pay that
ticket for you and clear that citation
all over your phone and just to rewind a
little bit so two years ago the way this
idea really started out was really just
a simple text interaction between two of
my friends who are really just being a
little bit silly and kind of hungry so
one of them said I won some chicken
fried rice and a coke my other friend
replied sure I'll get some started one
moment okay I can have that arrived in
45 minutes it's going to cost twenty
dollars do you want me to proceed so on
this day the chicken fried rice did
actually come and we thought this is
kind of a cool idea we realized there
were some appeal in this idea and really
over the past two years we've been
working really hard to build out this
service to build out magic and bring it
to more people and we've kind of had
several building it with several
advantages in mind compared to a
traditional what would you think of as a
conventional assistant so with magic
it's 24/7 which means you can text the
service any time of the day or night
everyday magic will respond within
minutes magic can do multiple requests
at one time so unlike an assistant might
be good at multitasking but magic can
literally do more than one thing
simultaneously and requires no effort to
hire or manage on on your part so magic
we want to never be able to get sick or
need to sleep or
on vacation and the cost of this we so
what you might pay an assistant for time
that that assistant is not spent
actually working with magic you pay at a
rate of $35 an hour that is prorated to
the minute and those minutes only the
time that the that magic has actually
it's been working for you it's charged
so that's that's what we have been
aiming to build and a lot of people
think about this kind of situation and
they imagine is a simple conversation
and the thought is oh this must be very
simple you just have someone on our side
who is fielding and reading these text
messages and then doing fulfilling the
request and sending the text messages
out what kind of software might could
you possibly need for that simple right
but we found that it actually very
complicated actually and it requires a
whole team of people and a lot of
software in order to provide those
application benefits that I was just
talking about the ability to do the 24/7
multiple things at the same time you
know on your side you don't have to
worry about hiring and managing and
training and magic does learn to get
better with you you don't have to train
magic to be a good assistant that's kind
of our responsibility and to have a
layer of quality control and data
security and routing of these SMS text
messages and phone calls from not just
us us to you but different vendors and
calendar ization and all these things
that need to tie together to make the
experience good for you it really does
take a lot of people and a lot of
software and the other thing that kind
of makes this a little more complex is
that the clients can ask and do ask for
really really anything so for for us to
be able to do that effectively we need
to really remove all the cognitive load
of you having to think about doing that
so thinking about these examples that
might sound simple so finding and
booking your flight renewing a passport
that's about to expire or renting out a
space and hosting a corporate event
there getting your apartment cleaned
sending flowers to a loved one or
managing your email these are all things
that seem like at first blush might be
kind of simple right don't you just you
have someone who books to fly
right but behind the scenes there's
actually a lot of complexity in the real
world that we need to keep up with with
the software and the operations so when
we're booking the flight right do we
know your frequent flyer number we don't
want to have to ask you again for that
if we already have that is there a
preference that you have in terms of an
aisle or seat on the plane renewing a
passport what is actually the fastest
way to do that and what are the pitfalls
and we need to be aware of those
pitfalls for the renting out space at a

coordinate with the venue if there's
going to be food there it has to be
catered we have to mitigate risks if
there's an outdoor space is it going to
rain maybe we have to erect a tarp to
protect people from getting wet there
and you know the flowers if a courier is
sending them there what happens if the

we're writing emails on your behalf what
is your communication style we need to
know that so we can communicate
effectively so all these things it
requires they require a lot of software
and we found that we really needed to
develop a whole ecosystem of almost like
little apps that target specific
business needs and with that we've kept
a few principles in mind pretty heavily
at magic so experimentation just really
important for us the ability to try out
a lot of different things in software
and to not necessarily know up front
what it is all the time that we're even
going to be building at the time we set
out to do that rapid iteration so the
ability to deploy code really fast and
break things really fast and fix them
when they're broken very important and
yogini which is a principle of
programming that we've kind of adopted
really heavily that magic as a startup
and it stands for you ain't going to
need it and what it is fundamentally
about is this idea that you shouldn't
add functionality to to software until
that functionality is really beamed a
truly necessary so instead of going into
a code hole for two weeks and building
out this crazy system that handles all
sorts of edge cases there's something we
can deploy tomorrow
that just goes zero to one
in solving a particular business need
and because really that whole thing that
you might have built out it really might
turn out to be the case that you ain't
going to need it so this is where we
kind of came to AWS and here's what it
kind of looks like a lot of people are
probably familiar the all the services

because we found that the we really need
an infrastructure to match these

we have and these different needs and I

they imagine them kind of like puzzle

like this more like a buffet so almost

there are needs of our business and
instead of the brownie it's services

sometimes they want to communicate with

so this thinking of these services of

at the time we had this need there are

at the time we were coming from a lamp

kind of nice knowing that there are
different paths that we could have taken
there another example of that so we kind

so what was the last time that someone

that just was just a matter of trying

to spin up
no that has powerful GPUs that we can

whatever neural architecture it is that

and we need to be able to get insights

basic thing that we needed right away
was just kind of basic interrogation
searching and reporting and so that to

going with that need but of course in

that are based on triggered events there
are options for us there I think one
thing that's interesting is when you

but the difference is that this wasn't

to make it look like this it's something

and we have to attack them kind of one

together like that and just to kind of
summarize I think the main benefits that
you know as a startup I think we've
gotten from thinking about things this
way is so first and foremost is
flexibility and comfort just knowing
that there are always multiple options

we have immediate business problems that
